snippet.title: MARATHON WATCH: Silence, then exultation in Boston
snippet.description: A look at the 118th running of the Boston Marathon. For further updates, visit http://bigstory.ap.org.

snippet.title: Thousands run first Boston Marathon since bombings
snippet.description: With security tight along the 26.2-mile course, nearly 36,000 runners set out from the Boston Marathon starting line Monday in a "Boston Strong" show of resilience a year after the bombing that turned the race into a scene of carnage.

snippet.title: Loudoun County and Fauquier County health calendar
snippet.description: Listings include blood drives, support groups, mental health services and resources for new parents.

snippet.title: D.C. area job market is gloomier in crucial government and contracting sectors
snippet.description: The latest Labor Dept. data show that government and contracting posted significant job losses.

snippet.title: Boston race makes room for those affected by bombs
Everest avalanche a reminder of risks Sherpas face
snippet.description: The rescuers moved quickly, minutes after the first block of ice tore loose from Mount Everest and started an avalanche that roared down the mountain, ripping through teams of guides hauling gear.

snippet.title: Democrats seek to reshape midterm electorate along lines of a presidential year
snippet.description: The party thinks it can better identify supporters, motivate them and get them to the midterm polls.

snippet.title: Everest avalanche a reminder of risks Sherpas face
snippet.description: The rescuers moved quickly, just minutes after the first block of ice tore loose from Mount Everest and started an avalanche that roared down the mountain, ripping through teams of guides hauling gear.

snippet.title: How the marathon bombings changed everything in Boston politics
snippet.description: In a city as obsessed with its politics as its sports, last April's attack fundamentally altered the political scene.
